title: CO County CVR Request (2022, 2024) (Routt County Clerk and Recorder's Office)

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Cast vote record (CVR) data for the following elections:
1. 2022 Nov Midterm Election
2. 2024 Nov General Election

Specifically, for each of these elections, I’m looking for the full anonymized record of votes cast in Routt County that is generated by the voting system.

In case it is helpful for your reference, you can find an example of these records in REDACTED format at this link on the Arapahoe County webpage: https://www.arapahoevotes.gov/transparency
If you follow the "Redacted Cast Vote Record (CVR)" link on that webpage, it will download a csv file with Arapahoe County's redacted CVR records (this: https://gis.arapahoegov.com/dl_data/cr_voter_data/redacted_cvr/REDACTED_CVR_Export_20241126111830_330948.zip.)

I am requesting these records NOT redacted pursuant to the Colorado Open Records Act. Please let me know if you need any further clarification on the type of data that I am requesting.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Aleksandra Conevska

SecureRelease™ Support (Contractor) 
securereleasepublicsupport@deloitte.com  Do NOT respond to this email. The SecureRelease™ Support desk is not operated by a FOIA Office or Agency personnel, and does not process requests--please do not send request details, supporting documentation, or other sensitive information to this inbox. Additionally, please note that SecureRelease™ Support is unable to provide updates concerning the processing, status, or timeline of requests, nor can we offer guidance with regard to agency procedures. For these inquiries, please contact the Agency or refer to their website.

title: Opioid Settlement Funds FOIA Spring 2026 McDowell County

communications.subject: West Virginia Freedom of Information Act Request: Opioid Settlement Funds FOIA Spring 2026 McDowell County
communications.communication:
Dear Donald Hicks:
Under the West Virginia Freedom of Information Act, §29-B-1-1 et seq., I am requesting an
opportunity to inspect or obtain copies of public records that pertain to the allocation of the total opioid settlement funds received by McDowell County, the application that individuals or organizations seeking funding from the county complete, copies of grant applications from individuals or organizations that have been approved to receive these funds, the names of individuals who will review the funding applications, any meeting minutes of county-level officials where the receiving or distribution of county-level opioid settlement funding was discussed, and how much funding has been awarded as of February 1, 2026 and to whom it was awarded. If there are any fees for searching or copying these records, please inform me if the cost will exceed $25. However, I would also like to request a waiver of all fees in that the disclosure of the requested information is in the public interest and will contribute significantly to the public’s understanding of the way state allocated funds are being spent. I am a student journalist working on a large scale project dealing with the funds allocated to the state of West Virginia from the National Opioid Settlement. This information is not being sought for commercial purposes. The West Virginia Freedom of Information Act requires a response to this request be made within five business days. If access to the records I am requesting will take longer than this amount of time, please contact me with information about when I might expect copies or the ability to inspect the requested records. You can call me at 330-978-8228 or send me an email at jlr00026@mix.wvu.edu. My physical address is 1511 University Ave. Morgantown, WV, 26505. If you deny any or all of this request, please cite each specific exemption you feel justifies the refusal to release the information and notify me of the appeal procedures available to me under the law.
Thank you for considering my request.
Sincerely,
Jessica Riley

communications.communication:

Imogen, Obviously
Author: Becky Albertalli
ISBN: 9780063045877

• School principals

title: OGC Legal Assessments regarding OBBBA Section 10107 and Byrd Rule Compliance

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: OGC Legal Assessments regarding OBBBA Section 10107 and Byrd Rule Compliance
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

I request all agency records from January 1, 2025, to September 1, 2025, including but not limited to formal legal opinions, final memoranda, and correspondence with the Senate Budget Committee, regarding the "Byrd Rule" compliance or "budgetary germaneness" of Section 10107 of the One Big Beautiful Bill Act of 2025 (OBBBA).
Please specifically include:
1. Final legal determinations regarding the USDA’s authority to implement the termination of SNAP-Ed funding via the reconciliation process.
2. Communications sent to or received from the Senate Parliamentarian or Senate Budget Committee staff regarding the "Byrd Bath" rulings issued on or about June 20, 2025.
3. Any Vaughn Index or detailed list of responsive documents withheld under Exemption 5, to ensure transparency regarding the existence of legal disputes over this provision.
I request that a search be conducted at minimum within theInternational Affairs, Food Assistance, and Farm and Rural Programs Division of the OGC, including the records of  Associate General Counsel Gena Kochan and her staff. However, this request is not  limited to this division; please search all offices within the OGC likely to possess  responsive records, including the Office of the General Counsel's immediate front office and the Office of Information Affairs.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Emma Lehman

title: San Francisco non-police ALPR Review

communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: BAAQMD ALPR Review
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

All documents relating to usage of Automated License Plate Recognition (ALPR) technology by the City of San Francisco, including only vehicle-based cameras. This EXCLUDES all ALPR technology belonging to the San Francisco Police Department, and instead focuses on non-law enforcement ALPR systems and technology. For City of San Francisco ALPR technology, we are requesting:

1) NDAs, MSAs, SOWs, and contracts relating to the purchase and maintenance of ALPR systems owned/operated by the City of San Francisco
2) ALPR policies, procedures, guides, and training materials 
3)  The names of agencies and organizations with which the City of San Francisco shared ALPR data in 2025
4) All "records of access" required by Sec. 1798.90.52(a) for the periods June 1st, 2024 until the date of processing this request (An audit log of ALPR queries, time/date, identity/role, agency, and type of data accessed will suffice). If your agency has a retention period shorter than 1 year, please provide whatever data is available based on your retention period. 
5) Any MOU or data sharing agreement which allows San Francisco City ALPR records to be shared or queried by non-administrative city staff (e.g. federal agencies, SFPD, etc.).
6) Any search warrants, subpoenas, or court orders you have received for ALPR data in 2025. 

Previously, I submitted a FOIA to BAAQMD based on finding ALPR cameras on a vehicle with their logo on it. They referred me to the City of San Francisco, stating that you own the vehicle. For more context, you may read my exchange with them and view a photo of the vehicle in question here: https://www.muckrock.com/foi/california-52/baaqmd-alpr-review-189686/

I appreciate your assistance. I'd be happy to chat and provide additional context to aid you in your search.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

title: FOIA Request: Congressional Correspondence and Internal Memos Regarding OBBBA Section 10107 (SNAP-Ed Defunding)

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: FOIA Request: Congressional Correspondence and Internal Memos Regarding OBBBA Section 10107 (SNAP-Ed Defunding)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

All agency records, including but not limited to emails, memoranda, legal opinions, and meeting minutes, from January 1, 2025, to August 1, 2025, regarding the following:
1. Correspondence between the Office of the Under Secretary for Food, Nutrition, and Consumer Services (FNCS) and the Senate Budget Committee regarding the "germaneness" or "Byrd Rule compliance" of Section 10107 of the One Big Beautiful Bill Act of 2025 (OBBBA).
2. Internal USDA memoranda or legal assessments produced by the Office of the General Counsel (OGC) or FNS Leadership discussing the procedural validity of defunding the SNAP Nutrition Education and Obesity Prevention Grant Program via the reconciliation process.
3. Directives from the USDA Office of the Secretary to FNS staff regarding the implementation of SNAP-Ed funding termination following the Senate Parliamentarian’s guidance issued on or around June 20, 2025.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Emma Lehman

title: PRA: Autopsy and coroner’s reports

communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: PRA: Autopsy and coroner’s reports
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act (Government Code Section 6250 et seq.) ("CPRA”), and all other applicable laws, please disclose the following records.

Any and all autopsy, death investigation, and coroner’s reports relating to the deaths of the following individuals:

1. Name: Jose Flores, Date of birth: 10-21-1981, Date of death: 04-19-2021
2. Name: Steven Quintana, Date of birth: 06-16-2005, Date of death: 05-19-2022

If records pursuant to this request are possessed in machine-readable format such as an .xls, .csv spreadsheet file, please provide the record in this format. Please disclose these records in the format in which they are kept, e.g., .ppt, .pptx, .doc, or .docx.

The fundamental rule of the CPRA is a presumption of public access. “In other words, [A]ll public records are subject to disclosure unless the Legislature has expressly provided to the contrary.” Williams v. Superior Court, 5 Cal. 4th 337 (1993). This presumption finds further support in the California Constitution, as amended by Proposition 59 in 2004. “A statute, court rule, or other authority, including those in effect on the effective date of this subdivision, shall be broadly construed if it furthers the people's right of access, and narrowly construed if it limits the right of access.” Cal. Const. Art. 1 § 3(b)(2).

Please provide a determination on this request within 10 days of your receipt of it. If you determine that any or all of the information qualifies for an exemption from disclosure, please note whether, as is normally the case, the exemption is discretionary, and if so whether it is necessary in this case to exercise your discretion to withhold the information. If you determine that some but not all of the information is exempt from disclosure and that you intend to withhold it, please redact it for the time being and make the rest available as requested. In any event, please provide a signed notification citing the legal authorities on which you rely if you determine that any or all of the information is exempt and will not be disclosed.

Please apply a fee waiver to this request. If the request for a fee waiver is denied, please provide notification of any duplication costs exceeding $50 before you duplicate the records. If the request for a fee waiver is denied, please further provide an index of all other requests since 2018 for which a fee waiver was denied, and the reason therefore.

Please respond to this request and disclose the records electronically by email to this MuckRock email address. Please let us know if you have any questions or if we can help ensure this request is the least burdensome possible for your agency while providing a correct and full disclosure in the public interest.

If you have any questions, please do not hesitate to reach out to me via email at dillon@muckrock.com, or by phone at (267) 314-7952.

Thank you.

Best,
Dillon Bergin

communications.subject: Public Records Request :: P000005-021126
communications.communication:
Dear Dillon  Bergin: 
Thank you for your interest in the public records of Sutter County. Your request has been received and is being processed in accordance with the California Public Records Act. Your request was received in this office on 2/11/2026 and given the reference number P000005-021126 for tracking purposes. 
Records Requested: To Whom It May Concern: 

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act (Government Code Section 6250 et seq.) ("CPRA”), and all other applicable laws, please disclose the following records. 

Any and all autopsy, death investigation, and coroner’s reports relating to the deaths of the following individuals: 

1. Name: Jose Flores, Date of birth: 10-21-1981, Date of death: 04-19-2021 
2. Name: Steven Quintana, Date of birth: 06-16-2005, Date of death: 05-19-2022 

If records pursuant to this request are possessed in machine-readable format such as an .xls, .csv spreadsheet file, please provide the record in this format. Please disclose these records in the format in which they are kept, e.g., .ppt, .pptx, .doc, or .docx. 

The fundamental rule of the CPRA is a presumption of public access. “In other words, [A]ll public records are subject to disclosure unless the Legislature has expressly provided to the contrary.” Williams v. Superior Court, 5 Cal. 4th 337 (1993). This presumption finds further support in the California Constitution, as amended by Proposition 59 in 2004. “A statute, court rule, or other authority, including those in effect on the effective date of this subdivision, shall be broadly construed if it furthers the people's right of access, and narrowly construed if it limits the right of access.” Cal. Const. Art. 1 § 3(b)(2). 

Please provide a determination on this request within 10 days of your receipt of it. If you determine that any or all of the information qualifies for an exemption from disclosure, please note whether, as is normally the case, the exemption is discretionary, and if so whether it is necessary in this case to exercise your discretion to withhold the information. If you determine that some but not all of the information is exempt from disclosure and that you intend to withhold it, please redact it for the time being and make the rest available as requested. In any event, please provide a signed notification citing the legal authorities on which you rely if you determine that any or all of the information is exempt and will not be disclosed. 

Please apply a fee waiver to this request. If the request for a fee waiver is denied, please provide notification of any duplication costs exceeding $50 before you duplicate the records. If the request for a fee waiver is denied, please further provide an index of all other requests since 2018 for which a fee waiver was denied, and the reason therefore. 

Please respond to this request and disclose the records electronically by email to this MuckRock email address. Please let us know if you have any questions or if we can help ensure this request is the least burdensome possible for your agency while providing a correct and full disclosure in the public interest. 

If you have any questions, please do not hesitate to reach out to me via email at dillon@muckrock.com, or by phone at (267) 314-7952. 

Thank you. 

Best, 
Dillon Bergin 

Upload documents directly: https://www.muckrock.com/respond/2215178/ 
Your request will be forwarded to the relevant County department(s) to locate the information you seek and to determine the volume and any costs associated with satisfying your request. You will be contacted about the availability and/or provided with copies of the records in question. PLEASE NOTE: The State Public Records Act does not require a governmental body to create new information, to do legal research, or to answer questions. 

Thank you for using the Public Records Center. You can monitor the progress of your request at the link below. 
Sincerely, 
Public Records Coordinator 
Sutter County California

title: Pete Sumalo Montejo ICE Death Report

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Pete Sumalo Montejo ICE Death Report
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

1. The ICE Detainee Death Report for Pete Sumalo Montejo, who passed away December 5, 2025, in ICE custody in Texas. 
2. A copy of the ICE ERO or IHSC Significant Incident Report or Significant Event Notification

According to the information currently published on ICE's website, ICE was under a Congressional mandate to release this information no later than 30 days after his death, and to update it no more than 60 days after each immigrant's death. ICE has released a Death Report for Jean Wilson Brutus and Shiraz Sachwani, both of whom died after Mr. Sumalo Montejo. 

I make this request under both 5 USC 552(a)(2) - which governs the agency's affirmative disclosure obligations - and 552(a)(3), which concerns the agency's obligation to respond to a request. 

Pursuant to 6 C.F.R. 5.5(e)(1)(ii) and (iv), I seek expedited processing of this request, and certify and attest under penalty of perjury pursuant to 28 USC 1746 that the following statements are true and correct to the best of my knowledge and current understanding: 

1. I am a member of the media, primarily engaged information dissemination. See www.MuckRack.com/Andrew-Free.

2. I research and publish regarding deaths in ICE custody. My work documenting deaths in ICE detention is published, cited, and relied upon by national media outlets, including the Washington Post, the New York Times, the L.A. Times, and others. 

3. As of the date of filing my filing of this request, ICE has not posted its Detainee Death Report for this individual. 

4. There is an urgent need to inform the public about the circumstances ICE is aware of surrounding this death. Congress is currently contemplating alterations to DHS and ICE's funding, and the facts of each death in custody directly impact demands lawmakers and the public may wish to press when authorizing future funding increases, or applying limits to them.

5. Deaths in ICE custody reached their highest numbers in 20 years in 2025, and they have been the subject of widespread media coverage, and there is significant reason to believe ICE's treatment of people in detention has not met the standards it claims it adheres to when defending its actions in public statements. This coverage has prompted a number of responses by DHS's Twitter page and other public statements, pushing back against the coverage.

6. I will make the records available to the general public upon receiving them.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Andrew Free

title: Deaths-in-custody

communications.subject: Illinois Freedom of Information Act. Request: Deaths-in-custody
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Illinois Freedom of Information Act., I hereby request the following records:

The database or records of all Illinois law enforcement agencies deaths-in-custody up to the date this request is ultimately fulfilled, including all deaths-in-custody reported pursuant both Illinois state legislation (730 ILCS 210/3-5) and federal legislation (34 U.S.C. § 60105), as well as all data dictionaries, database scheme documentation or other documentation on the collection and organizatin of the data. 

I request these records in their native digital formats and not in formats that degrade the accessibility of the records, such as tabular data converted to PDF or Word files. If converting the native digital format to another high-fidelity format, such as CSV or Excel, please take care not to introduce formatting inconsistencies or errors, which can occur in the conversion process (for example, encoding errors or the inclusion of internal unescaped quotation marks in CSV files). Should the records above represent certain values as numeric codes or abbreviations that are not self-explanatory, we additionally request all records necessary to interpret those codes and abbreviations.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Dillon Bergin

title: Audit letters of compliance for Danbury, CT 2018-2024

communications.subject: Connecticut Freedom of Information Act Request: Audit letters of compliance for Danbury, CT 2018-2024
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Connecticut Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

1. Management Letters: All final "Management Letters" or "Letters to Those Charged with Governance" issued by the City’s external auditors (including but not limited to CliftonLarsonAllen LLP) for the fiscal years ending 2018 through 2025.

2. Internal Control Deficiencies: Any written communications from external auditors regarding "significant deficiencies" or "material weaknesses" in the City’s internal controls related to departmental compliance with the City Charter, specifically regarding the qualification of officers under Charter Section 2-5.

3. Compliance Testing Records: Any audit "working papers" or summaries in the City's possession that document the testing of Oaths of Office for the Health Department Directors (Fernanda Carvalho, Kara Prunty, and Lisa Morrissey).

4. Single Audit Compliance: For the years 2018–2024, please provide the "Report on Compliance for Each Major State/Federal Program" that specifically addresses the Health Department’s adherence to administrative legal requirements.

Public Interest & Urgency: These records are of vital public interest following the $17 million verdict in Girolametti v. Danbury, which established a pattern of "reckless disregard" within City departments. The failure of three consecutive Health Directors to file mandatory Oaths of Office suggests a systemic failure of internal controls that the auditors were tasked to identify.

I request a response within the statutory four business days. If any portion of this request is denied, please cite the specific exemption and provide the name of the official responsible for the denial.

I also request that, if possible and pursuant to Conn. Gen. Stat. § 1-212(d), fees be waived as I believe this request is in the public interest and not made for commercial gain. The requested documents will be made available to the public at MuckRock.com.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 4 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Kevin Paige

Pursuant to the Colorado Open Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Cast vote record (CVR) data for the following elections:
1. 2022 Nov Midterm Election
2. 2024 Nov General Election

Specifically, I’m looking for the full anonymized record of votes cast each election generated by the voting system.

In case it is helpful for your reference, you can find an example of these records in REDACTED format at this link on the Arapahoe County webpage: https://www.arapahoevotes.gov/transparency
If you follow the "Redacted Cast Vote Record (CVR)" link on that webpage, it will download a csv file with Arapahoe County's redacted CVR records (this: https://gis.arapahoegov.com/dl_data/cr_voter_data/redacted_cvr/REDACTED_CVR_Export_20241126111830_330948.zip.)

I am requesting these records NOT redacted pursuant to the Colorado Open Records Act. Please let me know if you need any further clarification on the type of data that I am requesting.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Aleksandra Conevska

title: civil commitment of "sexually violent predators" data

communications.subject: Florida Sunshine Law Request: civil commitment of "sexually violent predators" data
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Florida Sunshine Law, I hereby request the following records:

For the most recent date available, I am requesting the number of sex offenders ("sexually violent predators") who are in civil detention or civil commitment in Florida.
Specifically, I request the following data as of the most recent date available: 

1) the total number of people civilly committed in Florida by sex for sex offenses; and, 
2) the number of people civilly detained in Florida by sex for sex offenses. 

If this data is not available by sex, I request the total numbers regardless of sex.
If this data is held by another state agency, I request the name of that agency.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Emily Widra

title: Temporary Flight Restriction FDC 6/2233 over El Paso International Airport (KELP

communications.subject: Texas Public Information Act Request: Temporary Flight Restriction FDC 6/2233 over El Paso International Airport (KELP
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Texas Public Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

I request copies of records related to Temporary Flight Restriction FDC 6/2233 over El Paso International Airport (KELP), effective February 11–21, 2026.

Specifically, I request:
   - Emails, memos, or communications between airport staff and the FAA, TSA, CBP, or other federal agencies regarding the TFR;
   - Internal briefings, meeting notes, or advisories prepared for airport leadership regarding the TFR;
   - Communications sent to airlines, tenants, or other airport users explaining the restriction;
   - Any internal security risk assessments or reports prepared in relation to the TFR.

This request does not include routine operational flight logs or air traffic control data. Please limit your search to the period from February 1, 2026 through February 11, 2026. 

If any portion of this request is unclear or overly broad, I am willing to confer promptly to narrow it further. I am seeking a speedy rather than a comprehensive one.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Russel Neiss

title: FDC 6/2233 - El Paso Airport Shutdown

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: FDC 6/2233 - El Paso Airport Shutdown
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

I request records sufficient to show the administrative and legal basis for issuance of NOTAM FDC 6/2233 & FDC 6/2234.

This request is limited to:
   - The written request, directive, or initiating document that authorized issuance of the NOTAM;
   - Any final written justification or determination memorandum, or internal review supporting issuance;
   - The identification of the FAA office and approving official responsible for authorizing the NOTAM;

This request does not seek air traffic control data, technical operational data, or classified intelligence materials. It is limited to final administrative records sufficient to explain the authority and rationale for the action.

To facilitate expedited processing, please limit the search to the FAA Air Traffic Organization and Office of System Operations for the period February 1–February 11, 2026.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Russel Neiss
